channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pelican crossing slow to change, 21st July
item.description:
The new dedicated pelican crossing on the west carriageway can often take an excess amount of time to change resulting in people dangerously sprinting across the road when they get fed up of waiting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Miserden Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light lit during daytime, 21st July
item.description:
Street light no 4 is on during daytime.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 23 Saint Paul's Street North, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inadequate road hazzard warning, 21st July
item.description:
The original thin black post (as in the rest of Cromwell Rd) were not properly marked until my vehicle had had the collision and been written off, due to being under the shade of a large tree and just after heavy rain and bright sunshine The offending post has been replaced by the Council but the other three sights on the same rd have been left in what I consider a 'dangerous condition. The Council have admitted this by replacing the offendin post with the correct one.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 155 Cromwell Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bicycle dumped in the planter at Edinburgh place shops, 17th July
item.description:
Bicycle dumped in the planter at Edinburgh place shops. Itâ€™s been there for two days so nobody is coming back for it can someone please pick it up

item.title: Overgrown hedges, 16th July
item.description:
Hello I'd like to report these overgrown hedges located at Gloucester Business Park, Brockworth. I can't find any way of emailing them directly so could you kindly forward this to them on my behalf. The hedges as you enter the roundabouts are so overgrown that they completely block your view making a safe roundabout dangerous. The hedges should not have been plated so close to the roundabout junction. Please see the attached picture for the locations. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Delta Way, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge, 16th July
item.description:
Hello There is a hedge at the bottom of the drive way of 87 and 85 Innsworth Lane. The hedge is shared between both properties and is so overgrown it's blocking most of the footpath. The only way to get around it is by walking on the grass as the footpath is obstructed. Thanks for your help
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 87 Innsworth Lane, Longlevens
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown Vegetation on Pedestrian/Cycle Path, 16th July
item.description:
Various sections of this shared path have excessive vegetation that impedes both pedestrians and cyclists. It needs addressing sooner rather than later.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 66 Liddington Road, Elmbridge

item.title: Fly tip in Layby on Cleeve Common Road, 15th July
item.description:
The location the the Layby / gated entrance to the wood part way up the Cleeve Common Road - on the brow of this slope to the right. What looks like a large sheet of plastic material has been flytipped there. Please can it be cleared up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep erosion at side of road where passing place is, 15th July
item.description:
At the location, the road narrows and there is a shallow passing place. On the field side - left - going up Aggs Hill, the road has been badly eroded and if a car in particular goes to far to the left side into the deep eroded part, it will be damaged. Please can this be filled in to at least allow vehicles to pass each other safely
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Horrific shredded litter, 14th July
item.description:
The entire stretch of the A417 from Zoons Court roundabout to Churchdown Hamburger roundabout is covered in shredded litter and debris from the recent grass cutting. It's an absolute disgrace. This should have been litter picked before. Everything from litter to traffic cones and plastic car debris has been shredded both sides of the carriageway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 90 Lavington Drive, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet
